description:
Location: Work is what you do, not where you go. For this role, we are open to remote work and can hire anywhere in Canada and the United States.

About The Opportunity

Manage a team of HR business partners; oversee and direct work that supports the business; push forward initiatives across the entirety of a functional business line (or multiple functional business lines) through strong partnership with Centers of Excellence to develop tailored and innovative people solutions.

As a trusted Advisor, you will establish close relationships built on trust; act as the sounding board, have open and direct conversations, challenge ideas and provide opinions to influence business decisions. You will be an advocate for employees, remind the leaders of impact of their decisions on their people.

What You’ll Get To Do
• Have a strong understanding of Dayforce’s business drivers and cultural/organizational dynamics, and in partnership with the leaders, you will provide organizational and people-related strategy recommendations to resolve business challenges.
• Maintain and improve all channels of employee relations, ensuring compliance with local jurisdictions; work in tandem with regional HR leadership to support
• Handle complex employee relations issues and/or sensitive data issues requiring discretion partnering with legal, investigations, and security.
• Review and analyze business unit data to identify trends and recommend solutions to business challenges, improve performance, retention, and employee experience.
• Partner closely with Talent Acquisition to identify and attract top talent; identify opportunities for internal talent mobility; formulate hiring plans and continuously update projections in collaboration with leaders.
• Working with Talent Management, collaborate on organizational design, workforce planning, succession planning, and skills assessment to support the successful implementation of Ceridian's strategic imperatives.
• Proactively identify training and development needs for individuals and teams and executing training and education for career development; support the design and delivery of training and education for career development.
• Partner with the Total Rewards team in driving compensation and benefits strategies and proactively identify challenges and opportunities within your client group(s).
• Lead high impact projects with on-time delivery, measurable outcomes and impact, and robust communication/change management; drive HR events such as annual review, compensation, and policy related implementations.
• Collaborate closely with other regional HRBP business partners to exchange best practices and ensure we are consistently delivering best-in-class service to our clients.
• Ability to communicate ideas, data, and thoughts well both verbally and written. Be comfortable challenging ideas and holding space for other perspectives to be heard.
• Other duties may be assigned.

Skills And Experience We Value
• 12+ years of total HR experience; minimum 5 years of leading a team of HR Business Partners ideally in a global, matrixed company.
• Understanding of, and experience with, core aspects of Human Resource Management (staffing; employee relations; labor relations; performance management; leadership development; training).
• Ability to think strategically and translate concepts into actionable items.
• Proven ability to influence decision making; courage to make tough decisions and deliver difficult messages with professional and poise.
• Comfortable working in ambiguous business situations; highly adaptable to a fluid and ever-changing work environment.
• Strong analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills.
• Excellent communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills.

What Would Make You Really Stand Out
• Previous talent management and succession planning experience preferred.
• Strong knowledge in employment laws; multi-jurisdiction experience preferred.
• Industry experience with a high growth technology company
